intro: Erigeron elongatus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides, and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are white to pale blue in color. Erigeron elongatus is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often used in native plant gardens.
